SENT.plain: With the aging of the population, the incidence and prevalence of cognitive disorders are increasing
Blood pressure plays an important role in the pathogenesis or clinical progression of stroke, vascular dementia, and Alzheimer's disease
Data from different studies reveal that the uses of antihypertensive medications decrease the risk of dementia and cognitive dysfunction
Several studies also have demonstrated a relationship between hypotension, cognitive decline, and dementia
In this review we are trying to demonstrate the relationship between blood pressure and cognitive function and also the effect of antihypertensive medications on dementia and cognitive dysfunction
